awd_titl_txt: Multinuclear Magnetic Resonance Studies of the Structure of Liver Alcohol Dehydrogenase Complexes
awd_abstract_narration: Preliminary studies will be performed to investigate the                        solution-state active-site structure of liver alcohol                           dehydrogenase (LADH) and its complexes with substrates,                         substrate analogs, and inhibitors.  The validity of the                         cadmium-substituted enzyme as a model for native                                zinc-containing LADH will be assessed 113Cd, 15N and 17O nuclear                magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy.  The feasibility of 17O                  and 67Zn NMR as methods to determine the nature of binding of                   substrate and water molecules to the active-site metal of                       native LADH will be assessed.
org_div_long_name: Division of Molecular and Cellular Biosciences
